original_title: Government to Make LG Employees Permanent
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – State Minister for Provincial Councils and Local Government, Janaka Wakkumbura, announced that the government is taking steps to make the employees yet unconfirmed of permanent status in local government bodies permanent soon. This includes, those employed on contractual-basis, freelance-basis and others. The process of collecting information in this regard has already commenced.
With a current total of 12,000 vacancies in local government bodies, Minister Wakkumbura assured that permanent appointments will be granted to fit these vacancies.
The State Minister expressed that Cabinet approval for this initiative will be obtained promptly. Currently, there are 10,000 non-permanent employees in local government bodies.
